Text.Value: I do mind. This isn't exactly my bravest moment; I'd rather suffer it alone.
Mrag. I'd like to see 'Memnos' rhyme in some heroic verse. Fine. I'll help.
You'd do better to find somewhere safe than wasting your time on me.
Prayers can wait - you're needed to help with the defences.
Why are you praying to the god of the dead?

EditorData.logicalname: Passed Passive Religion - Not Cleric of Kelemvor

Text.Value: Oh, I'll die today. That much I'm sure of. But I'll do it here, on my own terms. Leave me.
You have to try. We need every able body, or we're doomed.
*You realise he prays to Kelemvor, Lord of Death.*
Damned either way then... but at least I can go out with a weapon in my hand. All right. I'll do what I can.

EditorData.NodeContext: Reluctantly getting over his fears and agreeing to fight.

Text.Value: Damn you... fine. I'll see what I can do. Maybe I'll manage to take a goblin down with me.

EditorData.NodeContext: He's been convinced to help the defences

Text.Value: Kelemvor judges cowards more harshly than others. Better if you die in combat.
'Lathander to light, Selûne to guide, Kelemvor to show mercy -'

EditorData.NodeContext: Praying to himself. Interrupted by the player

Text.Value: You've solved one problem for us. Guess it's on us to solve the next.
'Lathander to light, Selûne to guide, Kelemvor to show mercy -'
Mind if I join you in prayer?
Leave the coward be.
Mrag. Of course I'm going to die... but I might as well get my hands dirty before that.

EditorData.NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

Text.Value: Well, seems like I'll be facing him before long. All of us will.
FIGHT, COWARD.
Leave me spend my final moments how I want.

EditorData.NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal language equivalent of 'shithead'. Pronounced m-rag-RESH-em

Text.Value: Why, because I'm not sharpening steel or strutting on the wall?
We're doomed either way. Best to stop struggling and hope the end's swift.
This is a beautiful place - and I can't bloody wait to be free of it.
Fine. I'll see what I can do. It won't be much - trust me.

EditorData.NodeContext: He's been convinced to help the defences

Text.Value: I doubt I'd still be drawing breath without your help. Thank you.
See you during the fight.

EditorData.NodeContext: A little more resolve than before

Text.Value: Crazy fool! Are you in a rush to see us all dead?!

EditorData.AnimationTags: Player draws weapon, moves in to attack

Text.Value: We won. I'd like to think Arka died happy, but... well. Perhaps now she's at peace.

EditorData.NodeContext: confused that he enjoyed killing goblins so much - think of him staring at her bloody hands

Text.Value: Spare me your empty threats and go away, mragreshem.

EditorData.NodeContext: mragreshem = infernal language equivalent of 'shithead'. Pronounced m-rag-RESH-em

Text.Value: *You recognise Kelemvor, the Lord of Death. The tiefling thinks he will die soon.*
Leave.
Attack him.
Mrag. Who needs goblins to be afraid of when we've you for company?

EditorData.NodeContext: Mrag pronounced mRAG (meaning 'shit' in the tiefling language).

Text.Value: I knew I smelled the stink of cowardice.
Kelemvor's judgement is always fair. You're wasting your time trying to curry his favour.
Better if you die in combat then live on as a coward.
Songs will be sung for today's heroes. Do your part, and your name will live on.
There's a horde coming for us all. Do you really think I care about your threats?
We... we actually did it. We thrashed the lot of them!

EditorData.NodeContext: confused that he enjoyed killing goblins so much - think of him staring at her bloody hands

Text.Value: You don't look busy.
I'll kill you myself if you don't grab a weapon and join the line.
Every fighter was once a novice. Better that than a victim.
What is it? I'm... I'm busy.
Leave.
Thank you, for talking some sense into me. I'll do my best when the fighting starts.

EditorData.NodeContext: trying to stay calm, but scared

Text.Value: I can pray a lot better than I can use a bow or a sword.
Prayer's all I've got right now. And best to pray to the god I'm liable to meet soon.
'Kelemvor to judge kindly, Helm to protect -'

EditorData.NodeContext: Praying to himself. Interrupted by the player

Text.Value: I don't care about my blasted name. The dead don't need compliments from the living. Leave me alone.
My god abhors cowards. If you do nothing, your fate is sealed in his eyes.
Can't you just leave me be? This is my last moment of peace.

EditorData.NodeContext: Just wants to curl up and hide

Text.Value: Don't... don't say any words over her. Arka wouldn't want that.
Please, leave me be. I said I was busy.

Synopsis: Memnos, a tiefling, is praying/hiding while the goblins attack the Druid Grove. He admits that he's lost his nerve and doesn't want to fight off the attackers. We can try to persuade him and give him courage; if we succeed, he'll join the defences. Fail, and he'll continue cowering.
